title: Understanding Conduct Disorder
text: Conduct disorder is characterized by a repetitive and persistent pattern of behavior that violates the rights of others or major age-appropriate societal norms or rules.

title: Key Features of Conduct Disorder
text: Children with conduct disorder often display aggressive behavior, deceitfulness, theft, and serious violations of rules.

hintAnswer: when children have ongoing pattern of aggression toward others with serious violations of rules and social norms at home, at school, and with peers
